title: Library LP Font
content:
Any ideas on this one, guys?

THANKS again...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Citta-notte_5122.jpg)
author: matango07030

comments.content: It looks like **[Reservoir Grunge](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-6%20%2F%20%28Freemium%29&ffam=ReservoirGrunge%20-%20Regular&fid=bac67ec1dc2ddced70b84bdbeef5c420&fsize=60&text=citta%20note&fit=1)** free font by Zeta Fonts [1999]
Annonce Grotesque, not available in digital form as far as I know.

It looks like Reservoir Grunge, but without the Grunge. I wonder what they used as a base?

Thanks to you both!!
[Annonce](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/annonce/) (Aurora Grotesk) is available from Canada Type.

If it's a Blue Note LP, that's probably [Venus Extended Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703/http:/typophile.com/node/41686#comment-256320), never digitized to my knowledge. Reservoir Grunge is probably based on actually. Best digital options: [Annonce](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/annonce) and [Vonness](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness)  
 [Previous discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184703/http:/typophile.com/node/118371) on this specific topic.
Thanks again to all of you...really appreciated.
